item.title: Homework of Week 6
item.description: 1. According to the von Neumann architecture, List basic parts of a computer: 运算器(processing unit)、控制器(control unit)、存储器(memory)、输入设备、输出设备(input and output mechanisms) 2. A computer has 64 MB (megabytes) of memory. How many bits are needed to address any single byte in memory? The memory address space is 64 MB, or 2^26 (2^6 x 2^20). This means it needs log2(2^26) or 26 bits, to address each single byte. 3. List basic parts of a CPU, include cache or not?
